`` The relation of hyperonymy is generally regarded as transitive : If A is a hyperonym of B , and B is a hyperonym of C , then A is a hyperonym of C . Following common practice , we call A a direct hyperonym of B , while it is only an indirect hyperonym of C. The same holds for the inverse relation , hyponymy .

The intuition behind Say ’s law is that each time a good or service is produced and sold , it generates income that is earned for someone : a worker , a manager , an owner , or those who are workers , managers , and owners at firms that supply inputs along the chain of production .

Firms are said to be in perfect competition when the following conditions occur : ( 1 ) many firms produce identical products ; ( 2 ) many buyers are available to buy the product , and many sellers are available to sell the product ; ( 3 ) sellers and buyers have all relevant information to make rational decisions about the product being bought and sold ; and ( 4 ) firms can enter and leave the market without any restrictions — in other words , there is free entry and exit into and out of the market .
